alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; McIntosh; Muskogee; Okmulgee; Sequoyah; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 02 at 9:30PM CDT until May 02 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MCINTOSH...NORTHWESTERN SEQUOYAH...SOUTHERN WAGONER...SOUTHERN CHEROKEE...CENTRAL OKMULGEE AND MUSKOGEE COUNTIES... At 930 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Pumpkin Center to 3 miles northeast of Morris, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Okmulgee... Sallisaw... Fort Gibson... Checotah... Haskell... Warner... Morris... Vian... Gore... Okay... Webbers Falls... Schulter... Oktaha... Marble City... Braggs... Taft... Boynton... Grayson... Council Hill... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 258 and 307. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Cherokee; McIntosh; Muskogee; Okmulgee; Sequoyah; Wagoner
